raw_text: Work such as (Cai et al, 2007) or (Boyd-Graber et al., 2007) use the document-level topics extracted with Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) as indicators of meanings for word sense disambiguation
clean_text: Work such as (Cai et al, 2007) or (Boyd-Graber et al., 2007) use the document-level topics extracted with Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) as indicators of meanings for word sense disambiguation.

raw_text: Abney and Light (1999) used tree structured multinomials to model selectional restrictions, which was later put into a Bayesian context for topic modeling (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007)
clean_text: Abney and Light (1999) used tree structured multinomials to model selectional restrictions, which was later put into a Bayesian context for topic modeling (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007).

raw_text: Boyd-Graber et al (2007) integrate a model of random walks on the WordNetgraph into an LDA topic model to build an unsupervised word sense disambiguation system
clean_text: Boyd-Graber et al (2007) integrate a model of random walks on the WordNet graph into an LDA topic model to build an unsupervised word sense disambiguation system.

raw_text: Boyd-Graber et al (2007) describe a related topic model, LDAWN, for word sense disambiguation that adds an intermediate layer of latent variables Z on which the Markov model parameters are conditioned
clean_text: Boyd-Graber et al (2007) describe a related topic model, LDAWN, for word sense disambiguation that adds an intermediate layer of latent variables Z on which the Markov model parameters are conditioned.

raw_text: Gibbs sampling updates for LDAWN are given in Boyd-Graber et al (2007)
clean_text: Gibbs sampling updates for LDAWN are given in Boyd-Graber et al (2007).

raw_text: Moreover, SemCor is also the dataset used in (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007), where a Word Net based topic model for WSD is introduced
clean_text: Moreover, SemCor is also the dataset used in (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007), where a WordNet based topic model for WSD is introduced.

raw_text: STM10 achieves similar results as in LDAWN (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007) which was specifically designed for WSD
clean_text: STM10 achieves similar results as in LDAWN (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007) which was specifically designed for WSD.

raw_text: However, topics are only inferred based on word co occurrence, while word semantics are ignored. Boyd-Graber et al (2007) are the first to integrate semantics into the topic model framework
clean_text: Boyd-Graber et al (2007) are the first to integrate semantics into the topic model framework.

citing_paper_authors: Linlin, Li | Benjamin, Roth | Caroline, Sporleder
raw_text: Previous approaches using topic models for sense disambiguation either embed topic features in a supervised model (Cai et al, 2007) or rely heavily on the structure of hierarchical lexicons such as WordNet (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007)
clean_text: Previous approaches using topic models for sense disambiguation either embed topic features in a supervised model (Cai et al, 2007) or rely heavily on the structure of hierarchical lexicons such as WordNet (Boyd-Graber et al, 2007).

citing_paper_authors: Linlin, Li | Benjamin, Roth | Caroline, Sporleder
raw_text: In another unsupervised system, Boyd-Graber et al (2007) enhance the basic LDA algorithm by incorporating WordNet senses as an additional la tent variable
clean_text: In another unsupervised system, Boyd-Graber et al (2007) enhance the basic LDA algorithm by incorporating WordNet senses as an additional latent variable.

clean_text: This dataset, which consists of 320,000 articles, is significantly larger than SemCor, which is the dataset used by Boyd-Graber et al (2007).

raw_text: Instead, we appeal to tree-based extensions of the Dirichlet distribution, which has been used to induce correlation in semantic ontologies (Boyd-Graberetal., 2007) and to encode clustering constraints (Andrzejewski et al, 2009)
clean_text: Instead, we appeal to tree-based extensions of the Dirichlet distribution, which has been used to induce correlation in semantic ontologies (Boyd-Graberetal., 2007) and to encode clustering constraints (Andrzejewski et al, 2009).
